fields.name: Snake Plant (Sansevieria)
fields.description: Also known as Mother-in-Law’s Tongue, it has tall, upright leaves with green and yellow variegation. Low-maintenance, survives in low light, and requires minimal watering. Air-purifying plant that removes toxins like formaldehyde and benzene.

fields.name: Pothos (Epipremnum aureum)
fields.description: Also called Devil’s Ivy, it has trailing vines with heart-shaped green or variegated leaves. Thrives in low to bright indirect light and is drought-tolerant. Great for beginners as it’s easy to grow and propagate.

fields.name: Peace Lily (Spathiphyllum)
fields.description: Recognized for its elegant white flowers and deep green leaves. Requires low to moderate light and helps purify indoor air. Prefers slightly moist soil but can tolerate occasional neglect.

fields.name: ZZ Plant (Zamioculcas zamiifolia)
fields.description: A hardy plant with waxy, deep green leaves that store water. Thrives in low light and requires very little watering (perfect for forgetful plant owners). Resistant to pests and improves indoor air quality.

fields.name: Aloe Vera (Aloe barbadensis)
fields.description: A succulent plant known for its healing gel used for burns and skincare. Requires bright, indirect light and minimal watering. Helps purify the air and adds a modern touch to indoor spaces.
